item.title: #SocialMediaComplianceWatch: analysis of Social Media Compliance Reports of November, 2021
item.description: Google (including YouTube), Facebook, Instagram, ShareChat, Snap, Twitter and WhatsApp have released their reports in compliance with Rule 4(1)(d) of the IT Rules 2021 for the month of November, 2021.

item.title: #SocialMediaComplianceWatch: analysis of Social Media Compliance Reports of October, 2021
item.description: Social Media platforms have released their reports for Oct 2021 in compliance with Rule 4(1)(d), IT Rules 2021. They continue to suffer from the same shortcomings, which exhibits lack of effort on the part of the SSMIs and the govt. to further transparency and accountability in platform governance.

item.description: We analyse the transparency reports submitted by Google, Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and Twitter in compliance with Rule 4(1)(d) of the Information Technology (Guidelines for Intermediaries and Digital Media Ethics Code) Rules, 2021.

item.title: Digital Transparency: A Right to Information Report for August, 2021
item.description: In the month of August, IFF has filed 64 RTI requests, 5 First Appeals and 1 Second Appeal. In this report, we give you an overview of the requests filed and an analysis of the responses we have received from the different public authorities.

item.title: Sustained, strategic litigation helps advance transparency in digital policymaking #SaveOurPrivacy
item.description: Updates from the High Court of Delhi on the writ petition of Saurav Das who is challenging the Central Information Commission’s order denying him information on Aarogya Setu.

item.title: Avoiding app bans with a nuanced policy approach #WhatTheBlock
item.description: The Government is looking to strengthen its stance on banning mobile apps. It is planning to come out with guidelines, flouting which any app can be banned. We feel that such wide scale banning operations undermine your digital rights. So, we wrote to them urging them to rethink the move.

item.title: We urge the DOT to unblock WeTransfer. Open up our RTI resources to the public. #WhatTheBlock
item.description: Popular file-sharing service service, “WeTransfer'' has been blocked by a direction issued by the Department of Telecom (DoT). We have approached it to recall it’s order.

item.title: Legal notice to the Delhi Government to immediately halt CCTV installations.
item.description: As the Delhi Government begins installation of CCTV cameras, we write to the Chief Minister of concerns with its process and lack of safeguards.
